text: Modern equipment of the Armenian Armed Forces. All effort is done to keep the tables up-to-date with reliable information available on open sources. The information is updated regularly. This page might contain equipment which are in use with the Artsakh Defense Army, as the equipment is sometimes used by both armies. ==Small arms== {| class="wikitable" ! style="text-align: left; width:13%;"|Name ! style="text-align: left; width:13%;"|Origin ! style="text- align: left; width:16%;"|Type ! style="text-align: left; width:9%; "|Photo ! style="text-align: left; width:48%;"|Notes |- ! colspan="5" style="align: center;" | Pistols and submachine guns |- |MP-443 Grach | |9x19 mm |150px |Used by special forces and police. To replace all previous generations of MANPADs. |} ==Anti-tank weapons== Anti-tank weapons of the Armenian Army as of 2008-2017 {| class="wikitable" ! style="text-align: left; width:13%;"|Name ! style="text-align: left; width:11%;"|Origin ! style="text-align: left; width:18%;"|Type ! style="text-align: left; width:9%; "|Photo ! style="text- align: left; width:48%;"|Notes |- ! colspan="5" style="align: center;" | Anti- tank weapons |- | RPG-7 | | Rocket-propelled grenade | 120x120px | |- | RPG-26 | | Disposable anti-tank rocket launcher | 120x120px | |- | MILAN | | Anti-tank guided missile | 120x120px | With locally produced night-sight {{cite web |author=Июль 16, 2013 |url=http://azeritoday.com/archives/43776 |title=Армения закупила противотанковые ракетные комплексы MILAN у Греции |publisher=AzeriToday.com |date=22 February 1999 |accessdate=12 November 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170730013915/http://azeritoday.com |- | RPO-A Shmel | | Thermobaric rocket launcher | 120x120px | rowspan="2" | |- | SPG-9 | | Recoilless gun | 120x120px |- | 9M14 Malyutka | | Anti-tank guided missile | 120x120px | NATO codename AT-3 Sagger |- | 9K111 Fagot | | Anti-tank guided missile | 120x120px | NATO codename AT-4 Spigot |- | 9M111M Faktoriya | | Anti-tank guided missile | 120x120px | NATO codename AT-4C Spigot C. Improved motor, longer guidance wire. Maximum range 2,500m, minimum 75m. Improved single HEAT warhead; penetration 400 mm versus RHA or 230 mm towards armour inclined at 60°. Appeared during the 4-Day War. |- | 9M113 Konkurs Armyrecognition.com Armenia Land Forces military equipment and vehicles Armenian Army. August 2013. | | Anti-tank guided missile | 120x120px | NATO codename AT-5 Spandrel |- | 9M113M Konkurs-M | | Anti-tank guided missile | 120x120px | NATO codename AT-5B Spandrel-B. Tandem warhead with extended explosive probe. The warhead penetration is 750–800 mm vs RHA. Adopted in 1991, 4000m range. |- | 9M133M-2 Kornet-EM | | Anti-tank guided missile | 120x120px | NATO codename AT-14 Spriggan. 50 launchers with 200 missiles purchased in 2013. First shown in 2018. Mistaken in many sources for the E version, however Armenian troops training on the missiles state that it has a range of 8km. |- | 9K114 Shturm | | Anti-tank guided missile | 120x120px | NATO codename AT-6 Spiral |- | 9K115 Metis | | Anti-tank guided missile | 120x120px | NATO codename AT-7 Saxhorn |- | T-12 Rapira | | Anti-tank gun | 120x120px | 100mm |- | 9P149 Shturm-S | | Tank destroyer | 120x120px | 27 systems purchased from Moldova. Displayed with 9M120 Ataka missile during the Defense Expo in Yerevan |- | 9P148 | | Tank destroyer | 120x120px | Armed with upgraded Konkurs-M missiles |} ==Vehicles== Military equipment Armenian Army as of 2008-2016The Military Balance 2016. – Page 178 {| class="wikitable" ! style="text-align: left; width:12%;"|Name ! style="text-align: left; width:8%;"|Origin ! style="text-align: left; width:18%;"|Type ! style="text- align: left; width:7%;"|Number ! style="text-align: left; width:8%; "|Photo ! style="text-align: left; width:47%;"|Notes |- ! colspan="6" style="align: center;" | Armoured vehicles |- |T-90S | |Main battle tank | 30 |150px |One T-90S won as a prize at the Tank Biathlon in 2014https://tass.com/russia/745333. Delivered in April 2016https://en.armradio.am/2016/04/28/t-90s-tank-armenians-won-in-tank- biathlon-2014-transported-to-yerevan/. |- |T-72 | |Main battle tank | 78 |150px || Variants in service: *T-72A *T-72AV *T-72B/B1/obr.1989 *T-72B3 Estimated 550 T-72 tanks are in service together with the Nagorno Karabakh Defense Army. In 2017, Armenia signed a contract with Russia to modernise all T-72 tanks and bring them to T-72B3 level. |- | T-55 | | Main battle tank | 2 | 150px | 3 T-54 and 5 T-55. Probably in reserve. |- | BMP-2 | | Infantry fighting vehicle | 81 | 150px | 50 units modernized/repaired by Russia in 2012-2013. Центр анализа мировой торговли оружием . p. 17. Possibly more in storage . |- |BMP-1 | |Infantry fighting vehicle | 12 |150px || Variants in service: *BMP-1P *BMP-1K *BRM-1K |- | BRDM-2 | | Scout car | 75 | 150px | Includes anti-tank variant |- |BTR-80 | |Armoured personnel carrier | 112 |150px | Possibly more in storage. . Number does not include unknown number of Infauna electronic countermeasure variants first displayed at the 2016 military parade. Военный парад, посвященный 25-летию независимости Армении, прошел 21 сентября в Ереване |- |BTR-70 | |Armoured personnel carrier | 11 |150px | Upgraded with new engines and 30mm gun |- | BTR-60 | | Armoured personnel carrier | 62 | 150px | Withdrawn from service |- | MT-LB | | Armoured personnel carrier | 52 | 150px | |- | Tigr "Մեր զորահանդեսից հետո Բաքուն հասկացավ, որ չի կարող լուծել Ղարաբաղի հարցը ռազմական ճանապարհով " [After Our Military Parade, Baku Understands that it Cannot Resolve the Karabakh Question through Military Means]. PanArmenian.net. October 14, 2011. | | Armoured personnel carrier | 9 | 150px | More ordered in 2015. Used by special forces, military police, light infantry and airborne units.
